tool.name: PIT:ORFall

param.name: minMain
param.label: the minimum length for the main ORFs in bps

param.name: min5
param.label: the minimum length of 5' uORFs in bps

param.name: max5
param.label: the maximum length of 5' uORFs in bps

param.name: distance5
param.label: the maximum distance between the end position of 5' uORF and the start position of its corresponding main ORF. When this value is set to 0, means that uORF must overlap with the main ORF

param.name: min3
param.label: the minimum length of 3' uORFs in bps

tool.help: This tool does the normal ORF prediction from the DNA sequences as well as detects the uORF which allows the user to do further analysis to see the effect uORFs bring to the protein expression level. There will be each result file for main ORFs, 5'-uORFs and 3'-uORFs. **The brief main algorithm** 1) Translate each DNA/RNA sequence into six frames 2) For each frame, the translation was split by the stop codon into segments 3) For each segment, find the left most start codon 4) If that ORF is bigger than the minimum ORF length, report it
